utils package¶

Submodules¶

utils.constants module¶

This module has constants used across the program

utils.constants.CKP_INTERVAL = 5000¶

Default value for the interval (Number of iterations) at which checkpoints are being saved

utils.constants.DATA_CALTECH_101 = 'CALTECH-101'¶

Name for CALTECH 101

utils.constants.DATA_CALTECH_256 = 'CALTECH-256'¶

Name for CALTECH 256

Name for CIFAR-10

Name for CIFAR-100

Name for Fashion MNIST

Name for MNIST

Name for Tiny Imagenet

utils.constants.SEED = 12345¶

Default value for the seed for random values

utils.constants.SUMMARY_INTERVAL = 200¶

Default value for the interval (Number of iterations) at which validation/testing are performed

utils.constants.TRAIN_MODE = <TrainMode.INCREMENTAL: 0>¶

It specifies the default Training Mode

utils.constants.TR_BASE = 'TR_BASE'¶

Name for the trainer that uses RMSProp

utils.constants.TR_REP = 'TR_REP'¶

Name for the trainer that uses Representatives for training

utils.default_paths module¶

This module has the default paths for the four datasets supported in the base version:

  • MNIST

  • CIFAR-10

  • CIFAR-100

  • FASHION MNIST

  • CALTECH-101

  • TINY IMAGENET

It also contains paths to the weights of some networks that use transfer learning

utils.default_paths.CALTECH_101_PATH = '..\\datasets\\101_ObjectCategories_EXTRA'¶

Default path for the directory where Caltech 101 is stored

utils.default_paths.CALTECH_256_PATH = '..\\datasets\\256_ObjectCategories'¶

Default path for the directory where Caltech 256 is stored

utils.default_paths.CIFAR_100_PATH = '..\\datasets\\cifar-100'¶

Default path for the directory where CIFAR-100 is stored

utils.default_paths.CIFAR_10_PATH = '..\\datasets\\CIFAR10_EXTRA'¶

Default path for the directory where CIFAR-10 is stored

utils.default_paths.FASHION_MNIST_PATH = '..\\datasets\\FASHION-MNIST_EXTRA'¶

Default path for the directory where Fashion MNIST is stored

utils.default_paths.MNIST_PATH = '..\\datasets\\MNIST_EXTRA'¶

Default path for the directory where MNIST is stored

utils.default_paths.TINY_IMAGENET_PATH = '..\\datasets\\tiny-imagenet-200'¶

Default path for the directory where Tiny Imagenet is stored

utils.default_paths.get_alexnet_weights_path()¶

It gives the default path of the weights of an AlexNet network previously trained over Imagenet

Returns

a string corresponding to a relative path

Return type

str

utils.default_paths.get_paths_from_dataset(dataset: str, base_folder: str = None)¶

It gives the default paths to the training and testing data of the supported dataset

Parameters

  • dataset – a string representing the dataset

  • base_folder – the base directory where the dataset is located. If it’s not provided, then the default values for each dataset will be used

Returns

a tuple, where the first value is an array of strings corresponding to the paths of each one of the mega-batches for training (if is_incremental is set to False then this array contains only 1 value corresponding to the path to the training data), the second value is a string corresponding to the path of the testing data, and the third value is an array of strings corresponding to paths specific for each dataset (e.g. bounding box archive path, metadata file path. The third value is an empty array in the case that the requested dataset doesn’t have dataset-specific paths.

utils.default_paths.get_vgg16_weights_path()¶

It gives the default path of the weights of a VGG16 network previously trained over Imagenet

Returns

a string corresponding to a relative path

Return type

str

utils.dir_utils module¶

Module with utility functions for directories and paths’ management

utils.dir_utils.create_full_checkpoint_path(model_name: str, config_name: str, inc_ckp_path: str, root='checkpoints', ext='.ckpt')¶

Creates the full relative path to a checkpoint. It also checks if the path exists

Parameters

  • model_name – the name of the dataset corresponding to the checkpoint (e.g. Imagenet)

  • config_name – the name of the Optimizer corresponding to the checkpoint (e.g. CEAL)

  • inc_ckp_path – a string representing the mega-batch and iteration corresponding to the checkpoint. It is expected to follow the format “[mega-batch]-[iteration]”, e.g. “0-50”.

  • root – the root directory where checkpoints are being stored

  • ext – the extension of checkpoint files

Returns

a tuple containing the generated path (str) and a boolean that says whether or not the generated path is a file that actually exists

utils.dir_utils.get_unique_logdir()¶

Creates an unique logging directory based on current datetime (year, month, …, seconds)

Returns

a string with a directory name. The returned value DOES NOT have any OS specific separator, e.g. it would return ‘log_2018-10-04-49-24’ and not ‘log_2018-10-04-49-24/’

Return type

str

utils.dir_utils.prepare_directories(config: training.config.general_config.GeneralConfig)¶

Creates and prepares the directories of checkpoints and summaries for TensorBoard

Parameters

config – the configuration that is going to be used in the whole training

Returns

a tuple containing a path for a checkpoint directory and a path for a summaries directory

utils.exp_helper module¶

Module with useful functions for performing an experiment

utils.exp_helper.perform_experiment(dataset_name: str, optimizer_name: str, checkpoint_key: str, s_interval: int, ckp_interval: int, seed: int, train_mode: utils.train_modes.TrainMode, train_dirs: [<class 'str'>], validation_dir: str)¶

Prepares and performs the experiment according to the configuration given by the user

Parameters

  • dataset_name – a string representing the dataset that has been configured by the user

  • optimizer_name – a string representing the optimizer that has been configured by the user

  • checkpoint_key – a string representing a checkpoint. Must be None if no checkpoint has been configured

  • s_interval – the summary interval that has been configured by the user

  • ckp_interval – the checkpoint interval that has been configured by the user

  • seed – the seed for random numbers

  • train_mode – Indicates the training mode that is going to be used

  • train_dirs – array of strings corresponding to the paths of each one of the mega-batches for training

  • validation_dir – a string corresponding to the path of the testing data

Returns

None

utils.exp_helper.print_config(dataset: str, optimizer: str, checkpoint_key: str, s_interval: int, ckp_interval: int, seed: int, train_mode: utils.train_modes.TrainMode, train_dirs: [<class 'str'>], validation_dir: str, is_menu: bool = True)¶

Prints the configuration selected by the user

Parameters

  • dataset – a string representing the dataset that has been configured by the user

  • optimizer – a string representing the optimizer that has been configured by the user

  • checkpoint_key – a string representing a checkpoint. Must be None if no checkpoint has been configured

  • s_interval – the summary interval that has been configured by the user

  • ckp_interval – the checkpoint interval that has been configured by the user if the dataset doesn’t have any dataset-specific path.

  • seed – the seed for random numbers

  • train_mode – Indicates the training mode that is going to be used

  • train_dirs – array of strings corresponding to the paths of each one of the mega-batches for training

  • validation_dir – a string corresponding to the path of the testing data

  • is_menu – boolean value. If set to True the menu version is used (asks for extra input)

utils.read_tensorboard module¶

This helper module reads multiple tests results (TensorBoard summaries) and converts them into a single folder with the average results of the metrics over all the executions

utils.read_tensorboard.create_average_from_tests(tests_folder: str, metric_tags, output_folder)¶

Reads the results from a set of tests relating to the same overall Experiment and produces files with the average results of the tests. This files can be read by TensorBoard

Parameters

  • tests_folder – the root folder where all the tests are located (e.g. ../summaries/CIFAR-10/TR_BASE). This folder must have the tests results located in one subfolder each, following the structure of summaries provided by the framework

  • metric_tags – a list of strings containing the metrics to be read (e.g. [‘loss’, ‘accuracy’]

  • output_folder – the root folder where the results are going to be written

Returns

None

utils.train_modes module¶

Module for defining training modes (e.g. training incrementally or accumulating the data of multiple megabatches)

class utils.train_modes.TrainMode¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Enum for multiple training modes

ACUMULATIVE = 1¶

Used when the data is presented in an acumulative way, that is, the megabatch 0 is presented, then megabatch 0 + megabatch 1, then megabatch 0 + megabatch 1 + megabatch 2, …

INCREMENTAL = 0¶

Used when the data is presented in an strictly incremental way, that is, the megabatch 0 is presented, then megabatch 1, …, and the data of a previously seen is not including for future training. This mode does not exclude the possibility of iterating multiple times over a single megabatch.
